meanings.sent1: She reseasons the soup to make it tastier.
meanings.sent2: After tasting the stew, she decides to reseasons it with more salt.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally reseasons the cake with sugar instead of salt.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter reseasons the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rain reseasons the dry earth, bringing new life to the plants.

meanings.definition: To add seasoning to food again.
meanings.sent1: He reseasons the grilled chicken for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: When the dish tasted bland, she knew she had to reseasons it.
meanings.sent3: The cat tries to reseasons its food with catnip.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reseasons the dinner table with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The wind reseasons the air with the scent of spices from the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To make something fresh or new again.
meanings.sent1: The artist reseasons the painting to bring out its original beauty.
meanings.sent2: She decides to reseasons her wardrobe by adding colorful accessories.
meanings.sent3: The magician tries to reseasons his old tricks with a new twist.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm reseasons the team with motivation.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise reseasons the sky with vibrant colors, signaling a new day.
